mapper.update: update reply set state = #{state} where reply_seq = #{seq}
mapper.select: select * from (select r.* ,(select count(*) from reply rr where rr.parent_seq = r.reply_seq) rr_count from reply r) r join member m on(r.writer = m.email and r.reply_seq = #{seq})

select r.* , m.* ,(select count(*) from reply rr where rr.parent_seq = r.reply_seq) rr_count from reply r join member m on(r.writer = m.email and substr(r.reply_seq, 0,2) not like 'rr' and r.board_seq = #{board_seq}) where state != '2' order by write_date desc
select r.* , m.* from reply r join member m on(r.writer = m.email and substr(r.reply_seq, 0,2) like 'rr' and r.board_seq = #{board_seq}) where state != '2' order by write_date
select g.email, g.parent_seq from reply r join good g on(r.reply_seq = g.parent_seq and r.board_seq = #{board_seq} and r.state != '2') where substr(g.parent_seq,0,2) != 'rr' and email = #{email}
select g.email, g.parent_seq from reply r join good g on(r.reply_seq = g.parent_seq and r.board_seq = #{board_seq} and r.state != '2') where substr(g.parent_seq,0,2) = 'rr' and email = #{email}
mapper.update: update reply set contents = #{contents} where reply_seq = #{seq}
mapper.select: select count(*) from reply where parent_seq = #{parent_seq}
